summary: Email chain between Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling interviews with two of Allred's clients who are willing to speak about their experiences with Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses logistics for meetings on September 18, 2019.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg corresponding with a federal prosecutor to schedule interviews with her clients regarding their experiences with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Gloria Mired
persons.context: Appears to have forwarded an email regarding interview scheduling; likely an assistant or staff member at Allred's law firm.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual with whom the attorney's clients had experiences; central figure in the investigation.

connections.description: Allred is representing clients who had experiences with Epstein, indicating an attorney-client relationship focused on allegations against Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled interviews with Epstein-related clients
events.description: Meetings scheduled between federal prosecutors and two of Gloria Allred's clients to discuss their experiences with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was representing clients willing to speak about their experiences with Jeffrey Epstein to federal prosecutors in September 2019.
One client's sister was also willing to be interviewed and reportedly had experiences with Epstein when she was over 18 years old.
The email indicates ongoing federal investigation activities in the Southern District of New York regarding Epstein shortly after his death in August 2019.
Security protocols required names of attendees to be provided in advance for building access.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and legally privileged, indicating sensitive nature of the discussions.
